ngiemboon: Cÿɔ́ʼ Ssé mbɔ́ɔntè yétʉ̂a tóŋ wé ntaŋ. N gyá tsɔ̌ cÿɔ́ʼsaŋ, mbà à ně fó tÿǒ lepwó ńgwe ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ. Mé náa kí lɔg ńtsɔ́ʼ ncwò pÿé té lǎŋ mbwó yé.
en: The fifth angel blew his trumpet, and I saw a star that had fallen from heaven to earth.   The key for the shaft to the abyss  # 9:1 Lk 8:31; Rm 10:7; Rv 9:11; 11:7; 17:8; 20:1–3 was given to him.

ngiemboon: Cÿɔ́ʼ saŋ awɛ̌ tsɔ́ʼ ncwò pÿé té lǎŋ. Ndyé fó wó ńkwɔ́ʼ páʼ ndyé gẅie é fóo jʉʼ gie mé tuɔ tsǎʼ wó la. Wɛ̌ ndyé pú ńjÿó jʉʼ tà mé té gíŋ ńgyá lejÿɔ́g nèm wɔ́.
en: He opened the shaft to the abyss, and smoke came up out of the shaft like smoke from a great   furnace  # 9:2 Gn 19:28; Ex 19:18 so that the sun and the air were darkened by the smoke from the shaft.  # 9:2 Jl 2:2,10

ngiemboon: Ngǐm kẅɛ́te tsɛ̀ɛ ndyé mmɔ̌g ŋwɛ́, ḿbú sa ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ. Mé ná metʉ̀ mbwó pɔ́b lélɔg ńtsɔ́gte pʉ̀a páʼ mengɔ̀ɔnssé mie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ ńtsɔ́gte pʉ̀a la.
en: Then locusts came out of the smoke on to the earth,   and power  # 9:3 Or authority, also in v. 10 was given to them  # 9:3 Mt 10:1; 28:18; Rv 6:8 like the power that scorpions have on the earth.  # 9:3 Dt 8:15; Ezk 2:6; Lk 10:19

ngiemboon: Mé tsẅii mbwó pɔ́b ngie tà pɔ́ gÿo nò tepòŋ na legǐ, ngie tà pɔ́ gÿo nò tepòŋ na tsɔ́ mmó gie á saʼá ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ, tà ńne sẅéte, ngie pɔ́ gÿo nò tepòŋ na tsɔ́ tÿǒ, ngie pɔ́ gÿo nò tepòŋ pɔ́ na pʉ̀a pie aliŋé ye Ssé á té na zǐ yɔ́b wɔ́.
en: They were told not to harm the grass of the earth, or any green plant, or any tree,   but only those people who do not have God’s seal on their foreheads.  # 9:4 Rv 7:3

ngiemboon: Mé la te náa wɔ́b metʉ̀, á gwɔ́ lélɔg ńzẅé pʉ̀a mesoŋ wɔ́. Á la gwɔ́ pɔ́ lélɔg ńnáa wɔ́b ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ nanǎ mesaŋ métʉ̂a. Eyɛ̌ ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ leen ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ gie nyìŋ gyǎ á fʉ̀ʼ gie ngɔ̀ɔnssé tsɔgɔ́ yé la.
en: They were not permitted to kill them but were to torment them for five months; their torment is like the torment caused by a scorpion when it stings someone.

ngiemboon: Á ge gwɔ́ na mesaŋ ŋwɛ́, epʉ̀a mesoŋ faʼa legwé, pɔ́ le gyá, é tsɔ́ɔn lékwé, tá legwé kÿo wɔ́b kÿo.
en: In those days people will seek death and will not find it; they will long to die, but death will flee from them.

ngiemboon: Eyɛ̌ ngǐm ŋwɛ́ e la gwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ melÿóon pie mé nyɛté wɔ́b lélɔg ńgʉa ńdÿɔ́ʼ ncù la. Atsɔ́ mmó laa twó pɔ́b, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ cÿɔ̀ʼɔ lefùɔ gie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ ńnyɛte la. Meshÿó mɔ́b gwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ meshÿó pʉ̀a mesoŋ la.
en: The appearance of the locusts was like horses prepared for battle.   Something like golden crowns was on their heads; their faces were like human faces;

ngiemboon: Menoŋo twó mɔ́b la gwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ menoŋo twó panzwě la. Mesoŋ mɔ́b gwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ mesoŋ púʼntʉ̀ la.
en: they had hair like women’s hair; their teeth were like lions’ teeth;

ngiemboon: Kʉ́kʉ́b wɔb la gwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ fʉ̀ʼ gie mé zǎb nzsǒ ncù gie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ńtsó á mǒ la. Pɔ́ gwɔ́ tà ne ńzie, mbabá mɔ́b gÿo jʉʼ zẅɛ páʼ fʉ̀ʼ gie mekélêg mie melÿóon tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ne shwoŋo, é ne ńzẅɛɛ ńcʉa ńgee ńdÿɔ́ʼ ncù la.
en: they had chests like iron breastplates; the sound of their wings was like the sound of many chariots with horses rushing into battle;

ngiemboon: Menkú mɔ́b lâ mesisìŋ mɔ́b gwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ mengɔ̀ɔnssé la. Metʉ̀ mɔ́b lélɔg ńná pʉ̀a ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ á na mesaŋ métʉ̂a éfóo na menkú mɔ́b.
en: and they had tails with stingers like scorpions, so that with their tails they had the power to harm people for five months.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie aa mbwó pɔ́b ńgwɔ́ páʼ fùɔ wɔb, ésáʼa wɔ́b, é gwɔ́ ssé tepòŋ gie e gẅiin nò na pÿé té lǎŋ, lezíŋ sé ée na shwóŋè Ébɛ̀ ńgwɔ́ lê Abandoŋ, ńgwɔ́ na shwóŋè pà Ngelékiya ńgwɔ́ lê Apoliyoŋ, ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie: «Ngàŋatág.»
en: They had as their king   the angel of the abyss; his name in Hebrew is Abaddon,  # 9:11 Or Destruction,# 9:11 Jb 26:6; 28:22; 31:12; Ps 88:11; Pr 15:11; 27:20 and in Greek he has the name Apollyon.  # 9:11 Or Destroyer

ngiemboon: Ndùŋmvfò ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ cʉ̌a. Á yɔɔn metsɔ́ mengʉ̀ngʉ̀ mémbʉ́a gwɔ́ nzèm ńne ńtóo.
en: The first woe has passed. There are still two more woes to come after this.

ngiemboon: Cÿɔ́ʼ Ssé mbɔ́ɔntè ntɔgɔ́ tóŋ wé ntaŋ. N júʼ tsɔ̌ ngyè fó na mendóŋ lekùɔ mie ée na jʉʼ gie mé tuɔ lìi wó ńkẅɛɛ. Ayɛ̌ jʉʼ gwɔ́ mvfò Ssé, mbà mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ ńnyɛte.
en: The sixth angel blew his trumpet. From the four   horns of the golden altar  # 9:13 Ex 39:38; 40:5 that is before God, I heard a voice

ngiemboon: Engyè ŋwɛ́ tsẅii mbwó cÿɔ́ʼ Ssé gẅie aa mbɔ́ɔntè ntɔgɔ́, á gẅie à la gẅiin ntaŋ ngie à kyɛ́ʼte messé tepòŋ lekùɔ pie mé la lɔg metsɛ̂n ńkwɛ́ɛ wɔ́b, pɔ́ gwɔ́ ngʉ̀ŋe ntse gẅie mé tóŋo lê Efelad la.
en: say to the sixth angel who had the trumpet, “Release the four angels   bound at the great river Euphrates.”  # 9:14 Rv 16:12

ngiemboon: Mé leen ńké ńkyɛ́ʼte messé tepòŋ apɛ̌ lekùɔ. Mbà Ssé la cwoŋte wɔ́b ńdɔgɔ ńzẅíʼte yɛ̌ lyɛʼɛ́ láʼ, á wɛ̌ saŋ, é yɛ̌ ngùʼ, légwɔ́ gie pɔ́ ge zẅé tàʼ nzsè á na pʉ̀a mesoŋ nzsè tá.
en: So the four angels who were prepared for the hour, day, month, and year   were released to kill a third  # 9:15 Rv 8:7–12 of the human race.

ngiemboon: N júʼ mé gɔɔn nzẅìŋ palÿɔ́ʼncù pie é lɔgɔ melÿóon ńgiŋe ngie pɔ́ ée mencùʼ nkÿo pʉ́a.
en: The number of mounted troops was two hundred million;   I heard their number.

ngiemboon: Wɔɔn aa páʼ e Ssé la nyɛ́ʼ nÿɔ́g mɔ́ɔn, n gyá melÿóon, tà mbɔɔ pʉ̀a pie é laa ndùm wó. Pɔ́ la maʼa kème nzsǒ ncù gie mé lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ńnyɛte, á gwɔ́ kʉ́kʉ́b pɔ́b ḿbaŋa páʼ mmɔ̌g la, ńgíŋe ńgʉme gʉme páʼ tsɔ́ tóon gẅie nzẅìŋ ée mǒ tɛʼ la, ńgíŋe ńne ḿbaŋa páʼ ffo tÿó gie á ne ńkwé la. Atwó melÿóon la gwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ twó púʼntʉ̀ la. Emmɔ̌g lé ndyé mbɔɔ tsɔ̌ ntí mekʉ̀a ne fóo ncwò pɔ́b ńkẅɛɛ.
en: This is how I saw the horses and their riders in the vision: They had breastplates that were fiery red, hyacinth blue, and sulfur yellow. The heads of the horses were like the heads of lions, and from their mouths came fire, smoke, and sulfur.

ngiemboon: Emmɔ̌g ŋwɛ́ pâ ndyé, mbɔɔ lâ yɛ̌ ntí mekʉ̀a ŋwɛ́, ée shúm sa sie é náa ngɔ́ʼ, mbà é la ne fóo ncwò melÿóon ńkẅɛɛ la, é la zẅé tàʼ nzsè na pʉ̀a mesoŋ nzsè tá.
en: A third of the human race was killed by these three plagues #— #by the fire, the smoke, and the sulfur that came from their mouths.

ngiemboon: Á nue metʉ̀ melÿóon é gwɔ́ pɔ́ ncwò pɔ́b, mbɔɔ na mesǎŋ mɔ́b. Mesǎŋ mɔ́b gwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ mennú la, ńgẅiin metwó, ńdɔgɔ pɔ́ mɛ̌ ńgÿo nò tepòŋ.
en: For the power of the horses is in their mouths and in their tails, because their tails, which resemble snakes, have heads that inflict injury.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa na pfwɔ̀ʼɔ pʉ̀a pie sɔɔn shúm sie é náa ngɔ́ʼ la te wɔ́b zẅé, pɔ́ ké te kúbe mà wɔ́b ńgwáʼ mefàʼ tepòŋ mie pɔ́ faʼa wɔ́. Pɔ́ la te nyé léguʼte messé tepòŋ wɔ́. Pɔ́ té nyé léŋwɔ́ʼ nnɛ́ mvfò shúm sie mé guʼte ngie ée Ssé wɔ́, é sie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ ńnyɛte, kà pɔ́ sie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ nkáb ńnyɛte wɔ́ɔ, kà sie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ŋwʉ̀ ńnyɛte wɔ́ɔ, kà sie mé la lɔgɔ tóon ńnyɛte wɔ́ɔ, kà sie mé la lɔgɔ kème tÿǒ ńnyɛte wɔ́ɔ, é shúm sie é té kuʼu légyá jʉʼ wɔ́, ńké te kuʼu léjúʼu nò wɔ́, ńké te kuʼu légiŋ wɔ́.
en: The rest of the people, who were not killed by these plagues, did not repent of the works of their hands   to stop worshiping demons  # 9:20 1Co 10:20 and idols of gold, silver, bronze, stone, and wood,  # 9:20 Dt 29:17; Dn 2:32,35,45; Hab 2:19; Ac 17:29 which cannot see, hear, or walk.  # 9:20 Dt 4:28; Ps 115:4–7; 135:15–17; Dn 5:23

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la gíŋe te kúbe mà wɔ́b, ńnyé lézẅé nyìŋ wɔ́, ńké te nyé lekàŋ wɔ́, ńké te nyé páʼ ngwɔ́ mbàŋa lâ panzwě tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b kẅɛ́te wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ pâ pɔ̌ nuŋe nuŋe wɔ́, ńké te tsǒŋ nyé.
en: And they did not repent of their murders, their sorceries, their sexual immorality, or their thefts.
